page.title: 14NETHERHALL & TOWER NURSERIES
page.content: Much of this farming area has fallen into decline though nearby nurseries flourish. The two visited are vegetable and cut flower suppliers to the wholesale trade.{Netherhall {Nursery}is a family owned business eatablished in 1919. The area covered by glass houses is 2.5 acreas. The nursery grows chrysanthemums only. 25,000 cuttings are planted each week. The cuttings are imported from Spain, the Canaries and South Africa. After 12-18 weeks the mature plants are cut and transported to wholesalers. In{Tower Nursery's}7 greenhouses, cucumbers and tomatoes are grown. This produce has been grown since about 1957. Cucumbers are the main crop taking ten weeks to mature. They are then harvested, sorted, graded and sold to Covent Garden or Spitalfields in London. Some go direct to the shop.
